I would like to mention two options not listed in the article ''Staying in Sync: All the Data, Up to Date, All the Time'' (April 27), about keeping files synchronized at work and at home.

The prices of CD burners have been falling (to close to $150), and they are becoming more available. With the low price of CD-R's (sometimes as low as 10 cents each), I often just burn a disc to take to work or home and then toss it when I'm finished. That lets me move around large amounts of data, more than 600 megabytes at a time).
For smaller files, I really like the convenience of Briefcase at Yahoo (briefcase.yahoo.com). It is easy to upload and download files, and Yahoo offers 5 megabytes of storage.
